body_html:
The test I wrote here #11056 reproduces the model deserialization glitch.

Similar issues have been discussed quite a bit in the Keras repo. I haven't seen a comprehensive solution, only workarounds. I wasn't sure if this should be reported here or there, but since I am using the tensorflow packaged Keras and I wrote the test in the tensorflow test-cases I thought to raise the issue here.
body_text:
The test I wrote here #11056 reproduces the model deserialization glitch.
Similar issues have been discussed quite a bit in the Keras repo. I haven't seen a comprehensive solution, only workarounds. I wasn't sure if this should be reported here or there, but since I am using the tensorflow packaged Keras and I wrote the test in the tensorflow test-cases I thought to raise the issue here.
body:
The test I wrote here https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/11056 reproduces the model deserialization glitch.

Similar issues have been discussed quite a bit in the Keras repo. I haven't seen a comprehensive solution, only workarounds. I wasn't sure if this should be reported here or there, but since I am using the tensorflow packaged Keras and I wrote the test in the tensorflow test-cases I thought to raise the issue here.
